intro: Pimpinella monoica, commonly known as the singleflower cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Pimpinella monoica is often found in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
